title: Chinese Situation
body:
It's kind of annoying when during games and you're trying to communicate with the team, some (Chinese) players literally refuse to communicate in  English, like the moment they speak in Chinese it's like they're not going back to speak in English, it's really annoying for the most part especially when you're trying to keep the team together. Will Riot actually do something about this? Or do I really just mute them and accept the situation as it is cuz yeah whatever. Also the same is for Koreans/Japanese/Etc.

PS: Is reporting them for Negative Attitude (not communicating in English, spamming Chinese) a valid thing to do?

replies.body:
I'd just like to butt in here and say, there's not actually an official language for the OCE server. Ask any given OCE player which language is the one to use and chances are they'll say it's "English", but that doesn't make it official, just community consensus. As Seras (more or less) tried to point out, a "language barrier", in and of itself, is not a reportable offence.

With that in mind, I do think there are legitimate reasons to report individuals who aren't using English in chat. The thing to keep in mind is that it's always best to report if you suspect someone of breaking the rules, even if you don't know what they're actually saying. Either the report will be deemed invalid, in which case nothing happens, or it will be deemed valid, in which case action is (rather, *should be*) taken.

It makes logical sense for Riot to have systems in place that deal with the various languages used in-game, particularly those which are "dominant" on particular servers. As Jason put it; "supposedly if they are being offensive they are meant to be banned", it doesn't help if Riot is allowing such behaviour simply because of "language barriers".

Chinese isn't a language, it's a nationality. Mandarin is the language (I assume no one is speaking Cantonese on OCE servers).

Fitzky has a point, it's not a minority that are trolls, it's a majority.

The solution is IP region blocks, if anyone in the OCE region is Chinese, they are welcome to play. If they live in China, and are blocked from their own server, then guess what? Just don't let them ruin everyone else's games on OCE as well.

It's not rocket surgery.
Thank you, it's good to know some people here actually understand what I'm saying instead of just blindly seeing me as a toxic annoyance.

The problem a lot of these idiots don't realise is even if there isn't an actual "language barrier" and you're entitled to speak in what ever language you want, there is still an overwhelming amount of trolls from this certain language group who are ruining games and most of them are doing it on purpose. If Chinese people are coming onto our server and ruining games for local players than it is not racist to call them out and want them gone. This of course doesn't apply to the few foreign people who just want to play the game and can't speak English too well, but unfortunately there's always the bigger group who ruins it for the rest of them.

"All ADCs are assholes cause a bunch blame their support for their mistakes".

Negativity bias. Especially a foreigner who doesn't speak much English is *far* less likely to type in chat that someone who sets out to troll. Just because a lot of the Chinese players you encounter *and are aware of* are toxic in some form or another doesn't make them the majority. 

A significant portion of the Chinese playerbase here speak perfect or near perfect English or rarely type at all, and you'd never even know they're foreign or immigrated most games. Should we throw them all under the bus just because there is a vocal minority of assholes? Should they not be allowed to type to their friends in their first language just because some people who are also Chinese suck? Some chicks are attention seeking assholes, doesn't mean they all are or that we should ban all girls from playing.

It doesn't matter what language they speak, or what gender they are etc etc. If they're an asshole, they're an asshole. So why don't we judge them for being assholes and not for speaking Chinese/x other language? It's not racist to call out assholes, it is racist to call out assholes and then tack on the fact that they speak Chinese just because.

>Should we throw them all under the bus just because there is a vocal minority of assholes? 

"Minority" Lmao

> there is still an overwhelming amount of trolls from this certain language group who are ruining games and most of them are doing it on purpose.


If you read what I said properly it's the other way around.

Is it though? You claim it's the majority of a certain language group, but it's only based on your own encounters, which more than likely barely scratches the population of Chinese players, nevermind OCE as a whole. Most people don't talk much in game, I'm sure you can attest to that. Should we ban all among those people who just happen to be Chinese?

Again, why not judge people based on their actual behaviour instead of what language they speak or don't speak??

Well I must be pretty lucky because I have yet to run into a single Chinese player who wasn't a stupid prick who wouldn't play the game properly and type negative broken English to me in chat. I actually remember making a post about a certain Chinese player I ran into a few months ago https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/e2A8cWUy-gotta-love-the-chinese-players

So all I can say from my own personal experience, they're all a bunch of trolls.

How do you know when a player is Chinese though? If they speak in Chinese sure, there's a pretty good chance they are, but if they haven't said anything at all? Broken English doesn't even mean they're Chinese, it just means their first language has different grammar structures, so pretty much any other language.

A troll is a troll. I'm sure you encounter plenty of trolls that aren't Chinese.

> How do you know when a player is Chinese though?

Maybe if they're name is "Xi Yang" or "Li Fei261" and they're not just typing in broken English of course they're typing Chinese as well. But the Chinese isn't the issue, like I said in my original comment you're entitled to speak whatever language you want. But when they decide to troll and I ask "What are you doing?" and they go off saying "I think umum very happy whe people fuxk her" or "Ur mums as shole" (which are both legit comments I have recorded), then I start to get angry at these people. 

Of course if one or two Chinese people troll I'm not going to start judging EVERY Chinese player the same way, but as I run into more and more of them and it's the same shit over and over I start to be convinced that all of them are like that in OCE. There reaches a certain threshold where the minority problem becomes the majority problem and that's what has happened from my experience.

Even if we were to assume it was a majority (which I vehemently disagree with), that still means there's a minority of perfectly reasonable Chinese players. Your suggestion seems to be to simply remove all Chinese players from the game, what of them? Should we kick out a whole bunch of innocent people because they share a particular trait with a group of toxic people?
No my suggestion wasn't to kick Chinese players from the game, my suggestion was to keep them out of OCE and in their LOCAL SERVER where they're SUPPOSE TO BE.
Ok so kick them out of OCE not out of game but what about the ones that *live here*?

learn English so its not so hard to play with them? I mean like once again it seems like discrimination but how far do people have to be handy capped? maybe you wouldn't get so much of them in low elo if they just learnt English

do you like to argue against common sense or do you just like the majority of players being soft skin and able to get away with everything (trolls, problem starters, game killers) because every post I see and click on I see fitzky making a great point although it may seem a bit upfront its a solid valid point and well the world is more upfront than that, I see you trying to twist points and try to make him seem toxic/stupid. I have no idea how you're a helper or what ever your green name means to boards but I never see you being helpful at all.
It's her job as one of Riot's minions to defend them against everything, no matter how bullshit or ridiculous it is.
While it may be Riot's view as well, I'm arguing *my* opinion here.
how do you know its a her? and yes but its getting annoying seeing the same bullshit excuses from the same person.
She has a YouTube channel and a Discord, pretty inactive though.
under a different name? or you found this out after arguing with her for so long?
Yeah Idk what happened to the YouTube channel, never was subscribed or anything, still got the discord server on my account though.
What you see as common sense I see as unnecessarily discriminatory. Judge people by their actions, not by their language/race/etc.
not learning how to adapt just because you don't want to is an action within itself.
You say that like it's easy to learn a new language, especially so one with a completely different grammatical and written system.
life isn't easy and this game is hard enough. countries in the oce reign learn English in school and what not so not its actually not that hard if you're not a brat.

Cant they implement a translator programe so that no matter what language is typed into chat, the language should appear in what language you have chosen in  your account. There are programmes for it out there. Tgen there would be no language barrier. Just a thought.

I don't imagine any of them would really be reliable enough to be considered at this point. You might just end up with a string of gibberish, which only confuses people more than simply not being able to read something. It's a nice idea, but I don't know how well it would pan out in execution.

>I don't imagine any of them would really be reliable enough to be considered at this point. 

Considering i prefer broken english then something i can't understand, i don't see the issue with it basically being google translator quality.

You'd find that a lot of what league players actually need would probably convert languages pretty unscathed.

I guess it depends a lot on whether they have their own slang for stuff, like we call blue buff just blue, but maybe they call it something else that doesn't translate. Google translate doesn't do too bad at day to day phrases but as soon as you get into less used words like those used for fantasy or slang it really runs into trouble.

While it might be completely off base to say, i feel like given the fact that some of the players come to EU and NA and shit, they generally are fine with the slang, so i doubt it'd be that big of a stretch.

At worst, we'd have to also know the asian translated version of each of the things we need (which would be worked out either by riot or players as soon as a system like this is in place.)

True enough. I'm just imagining the really formal translations you get sometimes like "we go to battle with the tiny slaves to earn riches and purchase treasures!" :P

Of course, the only real way to know how well it would work in execution is to actually try it, but if there isn't enough confidence/potential usefulness in the initial idea I don't imagine it'll go anywhere.

One day probably not too far away we'll have computers that can instantly and accurately translate languages and it'll no longer be an issue :P I mean, think how far google translate has come since it first rocked up.

>One day probably not too far away we'll have computers that can instantly and accurately translate languages and it'll no longer be an issue :P I mean, think how far google translate has come since it first rocked up.

Yeah but you can't copy+paste from League, you could translate shit if you could.

The idea being you won't have to copy paste eventually, it translates it on it's own. For now though, obviously an inconvenience, but you shouldn't really be alt tabbing to translate stuff in game anyway.
I mean sometimes i would like to copy for post game (for example the whole chat) so it can be translated.

pls no
it would be a real mess on eu servers with a bunch of gramatically different languages

I mean, you can report whatever you like, but it's pretty bm just to report someone for a language barrier and won't result in any punishments.

You can communicate pretty much everything just with pings now, so there's really no need to be so up in arms about someone less able to communicate verbally. Besides, them typing in a different language doesn't hurt you in any way does it? Given the significant other language speaking population it wouldn't be surprising to type in another language and find someone else in your game does too.

Sometimes it's also not that they refuse to communicate in English, but rather can't. We have a lot of exchange students, and a lot of immigrants who's English might not be the strongest, and when trying to communicate something fast when the timer is on they may simply default to their first language or be unable to express what they're trying to say in English. Or maybe they're just chatting with a friend.

You can report whatever you want, but speaking in another language isn't an offence, let alone a punishable one.
They shouldn't be playing on English servers. Most of the time its chinese smurfs or people who pretend they can't speak english just to bm you.
Heartvine said it better than I can.
just type "cao ni ma".

Just report them anyway, though i don't know how well Riot OCE tracks other languages, supposedly if they are being offensive they are meant to be banned (from what i seen they get away with it, but that might just be random chance.)

So far as I know things like cao ni ma is tracked pretty well, but I don't know what happens when other writing systems or less common languages get involved. Given if they do get punished they can't communicate that to us in a language we'd understand, there's a bit of a disconnect there.

Nah bro, the dudes that get banned on China server all come here, it's a thing.

The real issue is that players that get banned from the Chinese server come to play on OCE, and continue their poor behaviour here.

I'm not racist against Chinese (or other Asian people), hell I had two Chinese flatmates last year, and we got along well (to the point where when they moved out, they gave me gifts).

I have no issue with Chinese people (Mandarin is the language, Chinese is not a language) playing on OCE, but I do have an issue with all the banned trash from the Chinese server coming here to play.

First of all I want to say, under the globalization you can't stop that from all over the world  player exists in any corner of the world, unless the network can be developed without delay, game player can ignore the time difference, then all the game player are willing to play on their own server. First, consider a question from a realistic perspective. Can you ask a person who can trade with your country to leave your country and not to communicate with you? Even if he can't speak English. In addition, I believe that all people who can play LOL in OCE can speak more or less English, some of them may have bad grammar(like me) and poor vocabulary(still like me ). If they don't want to communicate with you, there's only one explanation that they don't care about you. But I believe don't care others’ feeling are personal problems, it's definitely not a national problem. If you often encounter some foreign players who refuse to communicate with you, then I'm sorry to hear that. 

To consider your problem from the perspective of the game, I don't know if you know, in Asia especially China, many professional players will go to South Korea's server to play and training, because their service is recognized as the most powerful server, but in fact, Chinese can't spell Korean, they are used to communicate in English. The reason that LOL can get so popular around the world is people of different cultural backgrounds, different languages can play the same game,  like other sports, which is a good thing, I believe that Riot will not prevent such cultural exchanges, because this is active, you can also check out how many foreign game player in OCE, I  believe in a lot of numbers (You might need to see New Zealand and Australia as a whole). If from the Esport perspective, each serves do need fresh blood is not it？

So enjoy the game, I believe you will encounter a kind of foreign friends, but you need to work on yourself, sometimes more of their own do not recognize themselves in the game do deficiencies, that others refused to communicate with you, others may just mute you, this may also be of course there.
